commands.init: Prepare current folder to generate a Sushi series
commands.live: Start the live mode: view changes to your Markdown live in your browser
commands.new: Add a new Sushi card to this series
commands.merge: Merge generated pdfs into a single one (requieres PDFunite tool)
commands.pdf: Generate the Sushi Cards in the specified output folder
commands.scan: Check if there are existing files in the directory
commands.sync: Update Sushi series details from existing Markdown files

liveoption.nobrowser: Avoid launching the browser with the first page
liveoption.notoolbar: The toolbar of chopsticks is not initialized

messages.dont_use_init: There is already an existing project, please use %s to syncronize your project
messages.no_config: There is no series configuration in this folder, but there is a %s file
messages.no_config_exec_init: There is no series configuration, please execute first the init command
messages.no_config_data_exec_scan: There is no series configuration, but there is a _data.json file, please execute scan command

newSushi.series_title: What is the name of your Sushi series?
newSushi.subject: What subject is your Sushi about? (e.g. HTML, Game Design)
newSushi.difficulty: Please rate the difficulty of your Sushi series:
newSushi.n_cards: How many cards are you going to include in the set?
newSushi.description: Please write a short description of your Sushi series:
newSushi.author: Who should be listed as the author of this series (e.g. CoderDojo Foundation or Diego):

data.exists: The series configuration file exists already
data.overwrite: Do you want to overwrite the series configuration file?
data.loadConfiguration: Do you want to load series configuration from the existing _data.json file?

pdf.bower_dependencies: Downloading dependencies of Sushi Card generator
pdf.download_template: Downloading Sushi Card generator from GitHub repository

pdf.render_tool: To generate pdfs you need to have installed %s (http://phantomjs.org/)
